trans-unit.source: Advanced encoding with Media Encoder Premium Workflow
trans-unit.target: Advanced encoding with Media Encoder Premium Workflow

trans-unit.source: Learn how to encode with Media Encoder Premium Workflow. Code samples are written in C# and use the Media Services SDK for .NET.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to encode with Media Encoder Premium Workflow. Code samples are written in C# and use the Media Services SDK for .NET.

trans-unit.source: Advanced encoding with Media Encoder Premium Workflow
trans-unit.target: Advanced encoding with Media Encoder Premium Workflow

trans-unit.source: Note Media Encoder Premium Workflow media processor discussed in this topic is not available in China.
trans-unit.target: Note Media Encoder Premium Workflow media processor discussed in this topic is not available in China.

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure Media Services is introducing the Media Encoder Premium Workflow media processor.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure Media Services is introducing the Media Encoder Premium Workflow media processor.

trans-unit.source: This processor offers advance encoding capabilities for your premium on-demand workflows.
trans-unit.target: This processor offers advance encoding capabilities for your premium on-demand workflows.

trans-unit.source: The following topics outline details related to Media Encoder Premium Workflow:
trans-unit.target: The following topics outline details related to Media Encoder Premium Workflow:

trans-unit.source: Formats Supported by the Media Encoder Premium Workflow – Discusses the file formats and codecs supported by Media Encoder Premium Workflow.
trans-unit.target: Formats Supported by the Media Encoder Premium Workflow – Discusses the file formats and codecs supported by Media Encoder Premium Workflow.

trans-unit.source: The compare encoders section compares the encoding capabilities of Media Encoder Premium Workflow and Azure Media Encoder.
trans-unit.target: The compare encoders section compares the encoding capabilities of Media Encoder Premium Workflow and Azure Media Encoder.

trans-unit.source: This topic demonstrates how to encode with Media Encoder Premium Workflow using .NET.
trans-unit.target: This topic demonstrates how to encode with Media Encoder Premium Workflow using .NET.

trans-unit.source: Encoding tasks for the Media Encoder Premium Workflow require a separate configuration file, called a Workflow file.
trans-unit.target: Encoding tasks for the Media Encoder Premium Workflow require a separate configuration file, called a Workflow file.

trans-unit.source: These files have a .workflow extension and are created using the <link><linkText>Workflow Designer</linkText><title></title></link> tool.
trans-unit.target: These files have a .workflow extension and are created using the <link><linkText>Workflow Designer</linkText><title></title></link> tool.

trans-unit.source: Encode
trans-unit.target: Encode

trans-unit.source: Encoding tasks for the Media Encoder Premium Workflow require a separate configuration file, called a Workflow file.
trans-unit.target: Encoding tasks for the Media Encoder Premium Workflow require a separate configuration file, called a Workflow file.

trans-unit.source: These files have a .workflow extension and are created using the <link><linkText>Workflow Designer</linkText><title></title></link> tool.
trans-unit.target: These files have a .workflow extension and are created using the <link><linkText>Workflow Designer</linkText><title></title></link> tool.

trans-unit.source: You can also get the default workflow files <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: You can also get the default workflow files <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The folder also contains the description of these files.
trans-unit.target: The folder also contains the description of these files.

trans-unit.source: The workflow files need to be uploaded to your Media Services account as an Asset, and this Asset should be passed in to the encoding Task.
trans-unit.target: The workflow files need to be uploaded to your Media Services account as an Asset, and this Asset should be passed in to the encoding Task.

trans-unit.source: The following example demonstrates how to encode with Media Encoder Premium Workflow.
trans-unit.target: The following example demonstrates how to encode with Media Encoder Premium Workflow.

trans-unit.source: The following steps are performed:
trans-unit.target: The following steps are performed:

trans-unit.source: Create an asset and upload a workflow file.
trans-unit.target: Create an asset and upload a workflow file.

trans-unit.source: Create an asset and upload a source media file.
trans-unit.target: Create an asset and upload a source media file.

trans-unit.source: Get the “Media Encoder Premium Workflow” media processor.
trans-unit.target: Get the “Media Encoder Premium Workflow” media processor.

trans-unit.source: Create a job and a task.
trans-unit.target: Create a job and a task.

trans-unit.source: Add two input assets to the task.
trans-unit.target: Add two input assets to the task.

trans-unit.source: a.
trans-unit.target: a.

trans-unit.source: 1st – the workflow asset.
trans-unit.target: 1st – the workflow asset.

trans-unit.source: b.
trans-unit.target: b.

trans-unit.source: 2nd – the video asset.
trans-unit.target: 2nd – the video asset.

trans-unit.source: Note: The workflow asset must be added to the task before the media asset.
trans-unit.target: Note: The workflow asset must be added to the task before the media asset.

trans-unit.source: The configuration string for this task should be empty.
trans-unit.target: The configuration string for this task should be empty.

trans-unit.source: Submit the encoding job.
trans-unit.target: Submit the encoding job.

trans-unit.source: The following is a complete example.
trans-unit.target: The following is a complete example.

trans-unit.source: For information on how to set up with Media Services .NET development, see <link><linkText>Media Services development with .NET</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For information on how to set up with Media Services .NET development, see <link><linkText>Media Services development with .NET</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Known issues
trans-unit.target: Known issues

trans-unit.source: If your input video does not contain closed captioning, the output Asset will still contain an empty TTML file.
trans-unit.target: If your input video does not contain closed captioning, the output Asset will still contain an empty TTML file.
